messages.subject: Camps Update:  Drama/Orienteering
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, Below is an update on our Spring Homeschoolers Camps. If appropriate, would you post this to your list? Thanks, Brenda ... UPDATE: 2nd Annual Spring
messages.messageBody:
Hi,

Below is an update on our Spring Homeschoolers' Camps.
If appropriate, would you post this to your list?

Thanks,

Brenda

----------------

UPDATE:
2nd Annual Spring HOMESCHOOLERS' OVERNIGHT CAMPS
April 26 - May 7 (12 days), Louisa County, Virginia
Oriented for ages 8-13 (parent's attendance optional)

Since our May 12 Adventure Camp is full, we've opened the April 26-
May 7 Camp as a combination Drama/Adventure. Children choose between
the two themes, and for two to four hours a day the focus will divide

between theater and orienteering. Otherwise, meals and activities
will be shared by the whole group.

Children choose their theme of interest:
DRAMA Theater games, practicing and performing a play for an
audience.
ORIENTEERING: Learn the exciting sport of land navigation using maps
and compasses.

Whole group activities may include: Canoeing, swimming,
cookouts, cooperative games, field games (such as soccer,
capture the flag, badminton, croquet, volleyball) scavenger hunts,
bird-watching, juggling, evening camp-fires/skits/singing

For more camp information and on-line registration:

http://www.twinoaks.org/community/childrens-camps/index.html


Or Contact: Brenda Callen, brenda@... (540) 894-5117

or (540) 894-5126, 138 Twin Oaks Rd. Louisa, VA 23093


(Sponsored by, and ~1/4 mi. from, Twin Oaks Community where
~100 people jointly own/manage land/businesses and govern
democratically. No central leader or religion. Run by a homeschool
mom, our secular camps enable homeschoolers to socialize &
learn together -- NOT a community recruitment effort. For more info
about Twin Oaks see our website.)
Twin Oaks Website: http://www.twinoaks.org
Camp Website:
http://www.twinoaks.org/community/childrens-camps/index.html
